UDLText.name: T
UDLText.Content: /* / Each role includes all the privileges of the ones below it. Roles are in / numeric levels. A controller uses the current viewer's role item in the / user record and compares it to the required role level. If the user level / "is as least as great" as the required level then access to the desired / process is allowed. */

Parameter.name: roleUser
Parameter.Description: Nearly all site users fall into the "user" role. A user can update their own demographic information and can read public documents.

Parameter.name: roleReportOnly
Parameter.Description: A report-only user can do only what a typical user can but can also request/read some need-to-know reports. This would be your typical line supervisor, ticket agents, process control managers, etc.

Parameter.name: roleAgent
Parameter.Description: An agent is allowed to make small adjustments to ledgers, can issue credits or refunds on a limited basis.

Parameter.name: roleSupervisor
Parameter.Description: A supervisor can modify user records for those under their charge.

Parameter.name: roleCorporateDBA
Parameter.Description: A corporate DBA can modify user records and data in various tables their company owns. A corporate DBA still can only see records that belong to their own company.

Parameter.name: roleSiteDBA
Parameter.Description: A site DBA can modify records for any company.

Property.name: activationKey
Property.Description: If the user must activate the account via clicking on a link in a email, the email key must match this value.

Property.name: lastGoodLoginDate
Property.Description: The epoch time when the user last logged in successfully. Failed login datetimes are cleared on a successful login.

Property.name: lastGoodLogin
Property.Description: The I-Type for the last good login date. This is a calculated property, not used in models.

Property.name: lastFailedLoginDate
Property.Description: The last datetime when a user attempted a login and failed. Accounts are suspended when the limit of tries has been reached. The suspension is temporary.

Property.name: lastFailedLogin
Property.Description: The I-Type for the last failed login dated. This is a calculated property, not used in models.

Property.name: attemptsSinceLastGoodLogin
Property.Description: Successive failed logins are counted here. If the speed limit time has passed then this value will be ignored.

Property.name: softSuspendUntilDate
Property.Description: The epoch datetime when a suspension for failed logins will be lifted.

Property.name: softSuspendUntil
Property.Description: The I-Type for the soft-suspend datetime. This is a calculated property, not used in models.

Property.name: privateKey
Property.Description: The user's private key against which personal data will be encrypted. The system computes this when an account is created. Do not change this value!

Method.name: validationRules
Method.Implementation:
do ..addValidationRule("usershadow_password", "Password") set atb = ..getAttribute("usershadow_status") set atb.valueList = ##class(EasyCSP.Core.Array).%New() do atb.valueList.split("NEW,ACTIVE,SUSPENDED,BANNED,INACTIVE") do ..setAttribute(atb)
quit $$$OK

Method.name: posixDateToExternal
Method.Description: Dates are stored as an integer value in the standard POSIX epoch. This function converts the internal POSIX date to an external representation.
